item.title: Elon Muskâ€™s Daughter Says He's Terrible At Overwatch
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/elon-musk-vivian-wilson-daughter-overwatch-torbjorn-1851773503

Every time I think weâ€™re done hearing about the Elon Musk fake gamer saga, a new bit of information comes out revealing that the Tesla and X owner who bought his way into an unelected government position is apparently bad at video games. Generally, I havenâ€™t paid too much attention to the developing story of Musk reportedly paying people to juice his Path of Exile account and having a terrible build in Elden Ring. However, now that it has intersected with Overwatch, a game that I have spent an ungodly amount of time playing, I have more context to understand that Musk is bad at video games, and itâ€™s all thanks to a story from his estranged daughter, Vivian Wilson.

Suggested Reading

Overwatch 2's New Story Missions: Worth The Money?

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Wilson made an appearance on Twitch streamer and political commentator Hasan Pikerâ€™s channel March 29, and along with talking about the difficulties of growing up as Muskâ€™s daughter, her gender transition, and the current political climate, she also talked about how her dad was a Bronze-ranked TorbjÃ¶rn main in Overwatch who relied on his childrenâ€™s skill to carry him in ranked.

â€œI can expose something that I think is really fucking funny,â€ Wilson said on the stream. â€œWhen I was like 12, he was Bronze in Overwatch, and me and my twin werenâ€™t, and he would try to constantly get us to play ranked with him. Iâ€™m 90 percent sure it was just because we could carry him. I was like a 12-year-old Hanzo main who was barely in Silver. He was a Bronze TorbjÃ¶rn main. He was fucking dogshit. Awful. Like, godawful. So no, I donâ€™t believe the fucking- â€˜I am a pro Path of Exile whatever the fuck.â€™ Like, no the fuck you are not. This is so cringe. Why would you even pretend to be? Itâ€™s fine not to be a gamer.â€

The Bronze ranking is funny enough on its own, but the revelation that he was having such a hard time climbing the ranks as TorbjÃ¶rn, arguably one of the lower-skill heroes on the roster, is also pretty good. However, nothing beats knowing he had to force pre-teens to help him climb out of the Bronze hole into the illustrious ranks ofâ€¦Silver.

All of this comes after years of Musk trying to position himself as a pro-level gamer in games like Path of Exile 2 and Diablo IV, seemingly in an attempt to buy credibility in the eyes of nerd followers who will stroke his ego on X and elsewhere. As his business ventures have grown over the years, people have become increasingly skeptical of his claims because one person running half a dozen companies likely doesnâ€™t have time to be sinking hundreds of hours into grinding away at video games. Now we have another story to add to the fake gamer saga, and the evidence is really piling up. I donâ€™t care that Musk might not be good at video games, but itâ€™s pretty funny that heâ€™s so desperate for people to think he is.

item.title: Final Fantasy IX Remake Rumors Intensify Amid Anniversary Hype
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/final-fantasy-9-remake-anniversary-merch-rpg-1851773483

This year marks the 25th anniversary of Final Fantasy IX and Square Enix has announced some celebration plans for the PS1-era RPG. The publisher said itâ€™s â€œpreparing various projects,â€ including new figures of the main heroes that slightly alter their appearance. Itâ€™s enough to have long-time fans once again believing the perrenially rumored Final Fantasy IX remake is real.

Suggested Reading

I Didnâ€™t Play Final Fantasy XVI â€˜Right,â€™ And Thatâ€™s OK

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

â€œZidane and Garnet from â€˜Final Fantasy IXâ€™ are now available in FORM-ISM!â€ the company announced today alongside a new soundtrack vinyl and other merch. â€œTo commemorate the 25th anniversary, they have been recreated in a three-dimensional form with a reinterpretation of the texture of their costumes.â€

Three-dimensional form? Reinterpretation of the texture of their costumes? Is this how both characters might look in an upcoming remake? Thatâ€™s one theory among fans, thanks to ongoing speculation about the possible existence of such a remake that dates back to its appearance in the infamous 2021 Nvidia leak, the one that kept proving to be legit again and again.

Rumors that the game would soon be arriving on modern platforms in some new shape or form were reaffirmed when Final Fantasy IX appeared in an Epic Games Store backend leak just last June. And Giant Bombâ€™s Jeff Grubb has repeatedly said the game is real, but will be closer to a Final Fantasy VII: Crisis Core remake than a full-blown overhaul.

Final Fantasy IX has a special place in many fansâ€™ hearts for several reasons. Itâ€™s an incredible game for one. It was also the last entry on PS1, and the last before the series moved to a full 3D look and voice acting on the PS2. Most importantly, it was the last produced by creator Hironobu Sakaguchi before he left Square, and harkens back to the franchiseâ€™s more traditional, medieval roots. Also it features an adorable black mage named Vivi.

In the past, Final Fantasy XIV producer Naoki Yoshida has been coy about the rumors. â€œOf course, I do know there are requests for Final Fantasy IX to be made, but when you think about Final Fantasy IX, itâ€™s a game with huge volume,â€ he said last fall, appearing to pour cold water on the rumors. â€œWhen you think about all of that volume, I wonder if itâ€™s possible to remake that as a single title. Itâ€™s a difficult one. It is a tough question.â€

July 7 will be exactly 25 years since the game shipped and Square Enix hints that fans should expect to hear more announcements leading up to it. Maybe a sneak peek of the game itself at an upcoming PlayStation or Summer Game Fest showcase will be one of them. I hope the game arrives alongside a revised strategy guide.

.

item.title: Palworld Devs Re-Reveal Degenerate High School Dating Sim That Might Actually Be Real This Time
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/palworld-dating-sim-april-fools-steam-trailer-pokemon-1851773472

The developers behind Palworld have re-revealed their furry high school dating sim (almost) nobody asked for. Itâ€™s called Palâ™¡world! ~More Than Just Pals~ and was almost certainly an April Foolsâ€™ joke the first time it was teased in 2024, but might actually be a real thing now?

Suggested Reading

Whatâ€™s Coming Out Beyond PokÃ©mon: The Indigo Disk | The Week In Games

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Thatâ€™s been the confused reaction of just about everyone whoâ€™s seen the announcement, which includes a complete Steam page and new trailer this time around, as well as screenshots and in-depth descriptions of all the main characters. â€œWhat lies inside the mysterious World Tree?â€ reads the store listing. â€œAn exciting school life filled with cute Pals! Will you remain friends or fall in love? Or dismantle and eat them...ğŸ´ Your dream school romance starts here in this Palworld dating sim!â€

Say hello to Splatterina (â€œIâ€™m good with crafts and medicinesâ€), Nurse Saya (â€œHuh? No drinking at school...? Donâ€™t be so uptightâ€), and Katress (â€œYou wonâ€™t be able to take your eyes off meâ€). Thereâ€™s no release date yet but the Steam page lists a whopping requirement of 4 MB available space.

The dating sim was first mentioned last April Foolsâ€™ day, just a couple months after Palworld had blown up on Steam and Xbox Game Pass. It leaned into the base gameâ€™s mix of cutenessâ€”adorable PokÃ©mon knock-off creaturesâ€”and depravityâ€”forced labor campsâ€”to suggest a romantic spin-off that would turn taboos into memes. Some players claimed to be disappointed that Palâ™¡world! ~More Than Just Pals~ wasnâ€™t actually real. The Palâ€™s paw might have just curled to grant their wish.

â€œNot again this april joke feels sad,â€ wrote one person on X. â€œApril joke? What? Wishlist now on Steam :)â€ replied the official Palworld account.

The latest Palâ™¡world! ~More Than Just Pals~ stunt arrives after the survival crafting simâ€™s one-year anniversary, and in the midst of a legal battle with Nintendo over patents for certain game mechanics that may have been infringed upon, like aiming and throwing a ball to collect a Pal inside it.

â€œPretty much everyone at Pocketpair is a huge fan, so it was a very depressing day, everyone heads down and walking in the rain,â€ community manager John Buckley told PC Gamer in an interview earlier this month. â€œIt changed a lot of things for us. We were just about to release the PlayStation version, we were just about to go to Tokyo Game Show, so obviously we had to scale back a little bit and hire security guards and stuff like that.â€

Fortunately for Pocketpair, I donâ€™t think Nintendo will want anything to do with Palâ™¡world! ~More Than Just Pals~.

.
